detailedDescription_md: Tourism Support Scheme 1 aims to provide support and services under the category Tourism. This scheme targets beneficiaries across states and focuses on outcomes like improved access, livelihood, and welfare.

applicationProcess.instruction: Check scheme guidance and eligibility on the official scheme page and the state tourism department site.
Register or apply through the Uttar Pradesh tourism portal (or state nodal agency) and submit required documents.

eligibilityDescription_md: Eligible citizens as per scheme rules.

benefits.name: Direct financial support
benefits.details: Subsidy or grant for tourism-related micro-enterprises and service providers to improve livelihoods and infrastructure.

benefits.name: Capacity building
benefits.details: Training, marketing support and linkages to boost local tourism services.

faqs.question: Who can apply?
faqs.answer: Local tourism entrepreneurs, homestay owners and micro-enterprises meeting state eligibility criteria; check the state tourism nodal office for details.

faqs.question: How to apply?
faqs.answer: Apply via the state tourism department portal or contact the district tourism office. See the official guidance at https://gov.in/schemes/1.

detailedDescription_md: Employment Support Scheme 2 aims to provide support and services under the category Employment. This scheme targets beneficiaries across states and focuses on outcomes like improved access, livelihood, and welfare.

applicationProcess.instruction: Check eligibility and scheme details on the official portal.
Register and apply through the Andhra Pradesh employment/training portal or district employment office.

eligibilityDescription_md: Eligible citizens as per scheme rules.

benefits.name: Employment support
benefits.details: Placement assistance, short-term wage support and on-the-job training for eligible candidates.

benefits.name: Skill training
benefits.details: Access to training courses and certification to improve employability.

faqs.question: Who can apply?
faqs.answer: Job seekers and eligible youth as defined by scheme guidelines. Check the state employment office for age/qualification criteria.

faqs.question: How to apply?
faqs.answer: Apply via the state employment portal or visit the district employment exchange. See https://gov.in/schemes/2 for guidance.

nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Women and Child Development
detailedDescription_md: Women Empowerment Support Scheme 3 aims to provide support and services under the category Women Empowerment. This scheme targets beneficiaries across states and focuses on outcomes like improved access, livelihood, and welfare.

applicationProcess.instruction: Review scheme guidelines and eligibility on the official portal.
Apply through the state women and child development department or district welfare office.

eligibilityDescription_md: Eligible citizens as per scheme rules.

benefits.name: Financial assistance
benefits.details: Cash assistance or subsidy for women-led enterprises and welfare initiatives.

benefits.name: Capacity building
benefits.details: Training programs for skill development, entrepreneurship and sanitation awareness.

faqs.question: Who can apply?
faqs.answer: Women meeting the scheme's eligibility criteria; check with the state WCD office for local rules.

faqs.question: How to apply?
faqs.answer: Apply via the state WCD portal or district office. See https://wcd.nic.in/ for guidance.

detailedDescription_md: Education Support Scheme 4 aims to provide support and services under the category Education. This scheme targets beneficiaries across states and focuses on outcomes like improved access, livelihood, and welfare.

applicationProcess.instruction: Review the scheme on the official portal and check enrollment windows for training or scholarship components.
Apply via the DIKSHA/education portals or state education department as specified in the scheme guidance.

eligibilityDescription_md: Eligible citizens as per scheme rules.

benefits.name: Training & scholarships
benefits.details: Access to courses, scholarships and support for eligible learners.

benefits.name: Digital resources
benefits.details: Online learning content and teacher training via national platforms.

faqs.question: Where to apply?
faqs.answer: Apply through DIKSHA or state education portals. Check official guidance at https://www.education.gov.in/.

faqs.question: Who is eligible?
faqs.answer: Students/learners and institutions as per scheme-specific eligibility criteria.

detailedDescription_md: Agriculture Support Scheme 5 aims to provide support and services under the category Agriculture. This scheme targets beneficiaries across states and focuses on outcomes like improved access, livelihood, and welfare.

applicationProcess.instruction: Check scheme components and eligibility on the official state agriculture portal.
Register/submit proposals through the state agriculture department or KVKs (Krishi Vigyan Kendras).

eligibilityDescription_md: Eligible citizens as per scheme rules.

benefits.name: Input subsidy
benefits.details: Subsidy on seeds, fertilizers and other production inputs for eligible farmers.

benefits.name: Extension & training
benefits.details: Access to agricultural extension services, training and demonstration plots.

faqs.question: Who can apply?
faqs.answer: Farmers registered with state land records and eligible under state norms.

faqs.question: How to apply?
faqs.answer: Apply using the state agriculture portal or visit the local agriculture office; see https://agri.maharashtra.gov.in/.

nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs
detailedDescription_md: Housing Support Scheme 6 aims to provide support and services under the category Housing. This scheme targets beneficiaries across states and focuses on outcomes like improved access, livelihood, and welfare.

applicationProcess.instruction: Check scheme details and eligibility on the state housing or urban development portal.
Apply through the state/UT housing portal or Common Service Centre (CSC) as directed by the scheme.

eligibilityDescription_md: Eligible citizens as per scheme rules.

benefits.name: Subsidy/loan support
benefits.details: Assistance for affordable housing including subsidies or access to low-interest loans.

benefits.name: Sanitation support
benefits.details: Assistance for sanitation facilities linked to housing upgrades.

faqs.question: Where to apply?
faqs.answer: Apply via state housing portal or local urban body. Some components may be available through CSCs.

faqs.question: Who is eligible?
faqs.answer: Eligible households as identified by the state/UT implementing agency.

nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
detailedDescription_md: Health Support Scheme 7 aims to provide support and services under the category Health. This scheme targets beneficiaries across states and focuses on outcomes like improved access, livelihood, and welfare.

applicationProcess.instruction: Refer to the official scheme guidance and registration process on the ministry/state portal.
Register through local health office or empanelled health providers as specified.

eligibilityDescription_md: Eligible citizens as per scheme rules.

benefits.name: Health assistance
benefits.details: Coverage for specified services, support for nutrition, and linkages with state insurance schemes.

benefits.name: Preventive care
benefits.details: Awareness, screening and immunisation support through public health channels.

faqs.question: Who can apply?
faqs.answer: Residents eligible under scheme guidelines; check the local health department for state-specific criteria.

faqs.question: How to register?
faqs.answer: Contact your district health office or visit the state health portal. See https://gov.in/schemes/7 for details.

nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
detailedDescription_md: Social Welfare Support Scheme 8 aims to provide support and services under the category Social Welfare. This scheme targets beneficiaries across states and focuses on outcomes like improved access, livelihood, and welfare.

applicationProcess.instruction: Check eligibility and application details with the state social welfare/department office or official portal.
Apply through district social welfare office or state portal; submit proof and follow verification steps.

eligibilityDescription_md: Eligible citizens as per scheme rules.

benefits.name: Pensions & allowances
benefits.details: Monthly pension or financial assistance for eligible individuals such as elderly, widows or persons with disabilities.

benefits.name: Welfare services
benefits.details: Access to schemes, concessions and social support services via state welfare departments.

faqs.question: How to apply?
faqs.answer: Apply through the district welfare office or the state portal. See https://socialjustice.nic.in/ for details.

faqs.question: Who is eligible?
faqs.answer: People falling in eligible categories as defined by the scheme (elderly, widows, persons with disability) and meeting income/other criteria.

nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises
detailedDescription_md: MSME Support Scheme 9 aims to provide support and services under the category MSME. This scheme targets beneficiaries across states and focuses on outcomes like improved access, livelihood, and welfare.

applicationProcess.instruction: Check scheme details on the MSME or state industry portal and confirm eligibility.
Register the enterprise and apply for credit/funding through state nodal agencies, banks or MSME portals.

eligibilityDescription_md: Eligible citizens as per scheme rules.

benefits.name: Credit & loans
benefits.details: Access to microloans, credit guarantees and startup support for registered MSMEs.

benefits.name: Market & training
benefits.details: Support for marketing, training and incubation services to boost enterprise growth.

faqs.question: How to apply for credit?
faqs.answer: Approach the designated banks, NBFCs or state nodal agencies; see https://msme.gov.in/ for central-level guidance.

faqs.question: Who is eligible?
faqs.answer: Micro, small and medium enterprise owners meeting the scheme's registration and sector criteria.

nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change
detailedDescription_md: Environment Support Scheme 10 aims to provide support and services under the category Environment. This scheme targets beneficiaries across states and focuses on outcomes like improved access, livelihood, and welfare.

applicationProcess.instruction: View scheme details and project eligibility on the official portal.
Apply for project funding or support through the state environment/forest department or designated nodal agency.

eligibilityDescription_md: Eligible citizens as per scheme rules.

benefits.name: Project funding
benefits.details: Grants/subsidies for renewable energy, water conservation or pollution-control projects.

benefits.name: Technical support
benefits.details: Capacity building and technical assistance for sustainable projects.

faqs.question: Who can apply?
faqs.answer: State agencies, NGOs and eligible project proponents as per scheme criteria.

faqs.question: Where to apply?
faqs.answer: Apply via the state environment department or the nodal portal listed on the scheme page (https://moef.gov.in/).

nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Finance (Department of Financial Services)
detailedDescription_md: Financial inclusion programme to ensure access to financial services such as bank accounts, remittances, credit, insurance and pensions.

applicationProcess.instruction: Visit any participating bank branch, bank's website or a banking correspondent/CSC to open a PMJDY account.
Submit identity and address documents; follow the bank's account opening process and complete KYC.

eligibilityDescription_md: Any Indian citizen (including minors with guardian) can open an account as per scheme rules.

benefits.name: Zero balance savings account
benefits.details: Zero balance bank account with access to deposit, withdrawal and remittance services.

benefits.name: Rupay debit card and insurance
benefits.details: Access to Rupay debit card, accidental insurance cover and overdraft facilities for eligible accounts.

faqs.question: Who can open an account?
faqs.answer: Any Indian citizen including minors (with guardian). Visit any participating bank or PMJDY portal to open an account.

faqs.question: Where to apply?
faqs.answer: Visit the official portal https://pmjdy.gov.in/ or any bank branch/banking correspondent/CSC.

detailedDescription_md: Income support scheme providing direct cash transfers to eligible farmer families to support agricultural needs.

applicationProcess.instruction: Check eligibility and register on the PM-KISAN portal or visit the nearest Common Service Centre (CSC).
Provide Aadhaar, bank and landholding details for verification; follow portal instructions for enrolment.

eligibilityDescription_md: Small and marginal farmer families meeting specified eligibility criteria (exclusions apply).

benefits.name: Direct cash transfer
benefits.details: Fixed annual support paid in instalments to eligible farmer families to supplement income.

faqs.question: How is benefit paid?
faqs.answer: Direct transfer to the beneficiary's bank account after verification; track payments on the PM-KISAN portal.

faqs.question: Who is excluded?
faqs.answer: Certain categories like income-tax payers and institutional landholders are excluded as per scheme rules.

nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
schemeName: Ayushman Bharat - Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PM-JAY)
detailedDescription_md: National health protection scheme providing health insurance cover for hospitalization to eligible families.

applicationProcess.instruction: Check eligibility on the PM-JAY portal or at empanelled health centres; eligible families obtain e-cards through the portal or local health offices.
Present the e-card at empanelled hospitals for cashless treatment; follow hospital admission/authorization processes.

eligibilityDescription_md: Targeted at economically vulnerable families as per SECC and state lists; eligibility varies by state rollout.

benefits.name: Cashless hospitalization
benefits.details: Covers specified packages and procedures at empaneled hospitals for eligible families.

faqs.question: How to check eligibility?
faqs.answer: Use the PM-JAY portal to search by name or Ration card, or visit a local health centre. See https://pmjay.gov.in/.

faqs.question: Is pre-authorization needed?
faqs.answer: Some procedures require pre-authorization as per scheme rules and hospital guidelines.

nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs
detailedDescription_md: Mission to provide affordable housing to the urban poor with central assistance to implementing agencies.

applicationProcess.instruction: Apply through the state/UT portal, local urban body or Common Service Centre; the PMAY portal lists your state link.
Verification and selection as per beneficiary list; follow allotment and sanction procedures.

eligibilityDescription_md: Eligible urban poor households as per selection criteria under mission guidelines.

benefits.name: Credit-linked subsidy
benefits.details: Subsidy on home loan interest for eligible beneficiaries under specified categories.

benefits.name: Affordable housing support
benefits.details: Assistance for construction/house with central and state-level subsidies as applicable.

faqs.question: Who is eligible?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries are selected using specified criteria and beneficiary lists maintained by implementing agencies.

faqs.question: Where to apply?
faqs.answer: Apply via the PMAY portal (https://pmaymis.gov.in/) or your state/UT housing portal or CSCs.

schemeName: Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA)
detailedDescription_md: Provides legal guarantee of at least 100 days of wage employment in a financial year to rural households willing to do unskilled manual work.

applicationProcess.instruction: Register at your Gram Panchayat to get a job card and apply for work demand; the NREGA portal has guidance.
Demand work through the Panchayat and report for allotted work on scheduled dates.

eligibilityDescription_md: Adult members of rural households willing to do unskilled manual work and enrolled under the scheme.

benefits.name: Wage employment
benefits.details: Guaranteed minimum days of wage employment in a financial year for eligible rural households.

benefits.name: Asset creation
benefits.details: Community assets such as roads, ponds and irrigation structures created under the programme.

faqs.question: How many days guaranteed?
faqs.answer: At least 100 days of employment per rural household in a financial year, subject to demand and provision.

faqs.question: How to apply?
faqs.answer: Register for a job card at the Gram Panchayat; see https://nrega.nic.in/ for details.

documents_required.name: Household details for job card registration

nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs / Ministry of Jal Shakti (rural)
detailedDescription_md: National campaign for elimination of open defecation, solid waste management and improving cleanliness across urban and rural areas.

applicationProcess.instruction: Contact your local urban body or Gram Panchayat for household toilet subsidy schemes and application procedures.
Follow local registration, verification and implementation steps as directed by the local authority.

eligibilityDescription_md: Households meeting specified criteria for subsidy and local community projects per mission guidelines.

benefits.name: Toilet construction subsidy
benefits.details: Financial support for constructing household toilets and infrastructure for community sanitation.

faqs.question: How to get subsidy?
faqs.answer: Contact your local urban body or Gram Panchayat; scheme information at https://swachhbharatmission.gov.in/.

faqs.question: What is ODF?
faqs.answer: Open Defecation Free status certified after community verification and fulfilment of program targets.

detailedDescription_md: Provides LPG connections to women from deprived households to promote clean cooking fuel and reduce health hazards from traditional fuels.

applicationProcess.instruction: Check eligibility and apply through the designated distributor or the PMUY portal; many states allow application through CSCs.
Complete verification and receive the LPG connection as per distributor schedules.

eligibilityDescription_md: Women of households below the poverty line (BPL) or as defined by state/central lists are eligible under scheme norms.

benefits.name: LPG connection
benefits.details: Support for initial LPG connection and subsidy for connection charges in certain phases.

faqs.question: Who is eligible?
faqs.answer: Women from BPL/deprived households; check PMUY guidance at https://pmuy.gov.in/ for state-specific details.

faqs.question: How to apply?
faqs.answer: Apply at the LPG distributor, through the PMUY portal or via a CSC as per local procedures.

detailedDescription_md: Crop insurance scheme to provide financial support to farmers suffering crop losses due to natural calamities, pests and diseases.

applicationProcess.instruction: Enroll with implementing agencies or nominated insurance providers through the state agriculture department or portal.
Submit crop and land details for coverage and follow claim processes if needed.

eligibilityDescription_md: Farmers cultivating notified crops in notified areas as per scheme guidelines are eligible to enrol.

benefits.name: Insurance coverage
benefits.details: Compensation for crop loss based on notified procedures and area-based or yield-based methods.

faqs.question: What does it cover?
faqs.answer: Losses due to specified natural calamities, pests and diseases under notified crop and area lists.

faqs.question: How to file a claim?
faqs.answer: Follow the claim procedures through the implementing agency or insurance provider; see https://pmfby.gov.in/ for details.

detailedDescription_md: Short-term skill training programmes to enable youth to take up industry-relevant skills and improve employability.

applicationProcess.instruction: Register at an authorized PMKVY training center using the PMKVY portal or visit local training centres listed on the portal.
Complete training and assessment to receive certification and placement support as per scheme.

eligibilityDescription_md: Youth and job-seekers as per scheme guidelines; different components for fresh, existing and special groups.

benefits.name: Certification
benefits.details: Recognized certificates on successful completion; possible placement assistance through employers and placement fairs.

faqs.question: Is training free?
faqs.answer: Many PMKVY trainings are funded and free for eligible trainees; check the specific training centre details on the PMKVY portal.

faqs.question: How to register?
faqs.answer: Register at authorized centres listed on https://www.pmkvyofficial.org/.

detailedDescription_md: Provides loans to non-corporate, non-farm small/micro enterprises to promote entrepreneurship and self-employment.

applicationProcess.instruction: Approach participating banks, MFIs or NBFCs with your business details and MUDRA application forms.
Submit KYC and business plan documents for loan appraisal and processing.

eligibilityDescription_md: Micro and small business owners in non-corporate sector; eligibility and loan caps vary by category (Shishu, Kishore, Tarun).

benefits.name: Collateral-free loans
benefits.details: Access to loans without traditional collateral under defined limits to encourage entrepreneurship.

faqs.question: What are Shishu/Kishore/Tarun?
faqs.answer: Categories under MUDRA based on loan size and stage of enterprise (smallest to larger ticket sizes).

faqs.question: How to apply?
faqs.answer: Approach a participating bank or MUDRA channel partner; see https://www.mudra.org.in/ for details.

detailedDescription_md: School meal programme to improve nutritional status of school-age children and boost attendance.

applicationProcess.instruction: Students are enrolled through participating schools; parents should contact the school authority for enrolment.
Schools/coordinating agencies handle meal distribution and record-keeping as per state guidelines.

eligibilityDescription_md: All children enrolled in government and certain aided schools as per scheme guidelines.

benefits.name: Nutritious meals
benefits.details: Hot cooked meals provided during school days to improve child nutrition and school attendance.

faqs.question: Which schools are covered?
faqs.answer: Government and government-aided schools participating under the Mid-Day Meal scheme; check with your school or district education office.

faqs.question: Is it free?
faqs.answer: Yes — meals are provided free to eligible students under the scheme.

nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Women and Child Development
detailedDescription_md: Provides food, preschool education, and primary healthcare to children under 6 years and their mothers.

applicationProcess.instruction: Register at your local Anganwadi centre to access services; Anganwadi workers maintain enrolment records.
Attend supplementary nutrition and health check-ups as scheduled by the Anganwadi.

eligibilityDescription_md: Children under 6 years, pregnant and lactating mothers in notified areas.

benefits.name: Supplementary nutrition
benefits.details: Nutritious food and health services for children and mothers.

benefits.name: Early education
benefits.details: Non-formal pre-school education and basic health check-ups.

faqs.question: Where to register?
faqs.answer: Local Anganwadi centre. Visit https://icds-wcd.nic.in/ for national guidance and contact information.

faqs.question: Who benefits?
faqs.answer: Young children and mothers in notified areas as per ICDS rules.

detailedDescription_md: Campaign to address declining child sex ratio and promote girl child education and empowerment.

applicationProcess.instruction: Community campaigns and registration are facilitated through state nodal points and WCD offices.
Participate in outreach activities and apply for linked benefits via state portals or district offices.

eligibilityDescription_md: Programmatic support available to communities and families; benefits depend on linked schemes and state implementation.

benefits.name: Awareness & support
benefits.details: Community outreach, incentives via linked schemes and empowerment programs for girls.

faqs.question: What is the aim?
faqs.answer: Improve child sex ratio and promote girl education and empowerment through coordinated actions at national and state levels.

faqs.question: Who runs it?
faqs.answer: Ministry of Women and Child Development in coordination with states.

nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
detailedDescription_md: Provides social assistance to elderly, widows and persons with disabilities in the form of pensions and support.

applicationProcess.instruction: Apply through the district social welfare office or state portal; verify scheme-specific documentation requirements.
Undergo verification and receive pension payments as per rules.

eligibilityDescription_md: Eligible individuals as per age/disability/widow criteria and income thresholds defined by state/central rules.

benefits.name: Pension support
benefits.details: Monthly assistance to eligible elderly, widows and persons with disabilities under NSAP components.

faqs.question: Who is eligible?
faqs.answer: Elderly, widows and persons with disabilities meeting criteria; check the district social welfare office for details.

faqs.question: How to apply?
faqs.answer: Apply via the district office or state portal; refer to https://socialjustice.nic.in/ for central guidance.

schemeName: Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Gram Jyoti Yojana (DDUGJY)
detailedDescription_md: Focused on rural electrification and strengthening power infrastructure in rural areas.

applicationProcess.instruction: State utilities submit project proposals to the central nodal agencies as per scheme guidelines.
Implementation and beneficiary targeting is done by state utilities and district authorities.

eligibilityDescription_md: Works and projects identified and approved by implementing agencies for rural areas.

benefits.name: Electricity access
benefits.details: Improved electricity connections and infrastructure for rural households and villages.

faqs.question: Who implements?
faqs.answer: State power utilities with central support and monitoring agencies.

schemeName: National Programme for Provision of Basic Amenities to Urban Poor (up-gradation) - (example placeholder)
detailedDescription_md: (Placeholder entry representing typical urban-poverty alleviation programmes; replace with specific programme details as needed).

applicationProcess.instruction: Contact local urban body for programme details and application process.

eligibilityDescription_md: Depends on specific programme rules and local implementation.

benefits.name: Localised support
benefits.details: Improved access to amenities, shelter and essential services for urban poor households.

faqs.question: Is this central?
faqs.answer: Many urban poverty alleviation schemes have central/state components; local authorities implement specific programmes.

schemeName: Seekho aur Kamao (Learn & Earn) - Skill development for minorities
detailedDescription_md: Skill training and placement assistance for minority youth through accredited training providers.

applicationProcess.instruction: Register at designated training centres or on the minority affairs portal; find accredited centres on the nodal portal.
Complete training and placement assistance processes as provided by the implementing agency.

eligibilityDescription_md: Minority community youth meeting scheme age and education criteria.

benefits.name: Training & placement
benefits.details: Skill certification and job linkages through participating training providers.

faqs.question: Is it free?
faqs.answer: Many trainings under the scheme are centrally funded; check the scheme page for details and eligible centres.

detailedDescription_md: Aim to provide safe and adequate drinking water through individual household tap connections to all rural households.

applicationProcess.instruction: State PHE/implementing agencies submit plans and households contact local authorities for connection details.
Household connection applications are processed locally and rolled out per state implementation plan.

eligibilityDescription_md: Rural households prioritized for piped potable water connections under mission guidelines.

benefits.name: Household tap connections
benefits.details: Safe and reliable drinking water supply to individual households.

faqs.question: Who implements?
faqs.answer: State/UT and local bodies in coordination with the central ministry; see https://jaljeevanmission.gov.in/ for guidance.

detailedDescription_md: Programme to transform India into a digitally empowered society and knowledge economy through digital infrastructure and services.

applicationProcess.instruction: Access services through MyGov, Digital India platforms or designated portals depending on the service.

eligibilityDescription_md: Citizens, businesses and government bodies can use the digital platforms and services as per service rules.

benefits.name: Access to e-services
benefits.details: Online government services, e-governance portals and digital identity benefits.

faqs.question: How to access?
faqs.answer: Visit Digital India portals and linked services; some services require registration with MyGov or specific department portals.

detailedDescription_md: Initiative to build a strong ecosystem for nurturing innovation-led start-ups through funding, incubators and regulatory support.

applicationProcess.instruction: Register your startup on the Startup India portal and complete the verification steps.
Apply for benefits, funding and incubator support through the Startup India dashboard as applicable.

eligibilityDescription_md: Innovative entities meeting the definition of startup, as per DPIIT.

benefits.name: Tax & compliance benefits
benefits.details: Regulatory and fiscal benefits, incubator and funding support for recognised startups.

faqs.question: How to apply?
faqs.answer: Register online at https://www.startupindia.gov.in/ and explore available schemes and benefits.

name: Digital India
ministry: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
desc: A flagship programme aimed at transforming India into a digitally empowered society and knowledge economy.

name: Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation (AMRUT)
ministry: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs
desc: Provides basic civic services such as water supply, sewerage, and green spaces in urban areas.

name: National Education Policy (NEP) Implementation Support
ministry: Ministry of Education
desc: Framework and support mechanisms to overhaul and modernize India's education system.

name: Skill India Mission
ministry: Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship
desc: Mission to train over 40 crore people in India in different skills by 2022 and beyond.

name: National Rural Livelihood Mission (NRLM)
ministry: Ministry of Rural Development
desc: Aims at promoting self-employment and organization of rural poor into SHGs.

name: Samagra Shiksha Abhiyan
ministry: Ministry of Education
desc: Integrated scheme for school education covering pre-school to class 12.

name: Beti Bachao Beti Padhao
ministry: Ministry of Women and Child Development
desc: Aims to improve child sex ratio and promote education for the girl child.

name: Ayushman Bharat Health and Wellness Centres
ministry: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
desc: Establishing 1.5 lakh centers to provide comprehensive primary healthcare.

name: Ujjwala 2.0
ministry: Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas
desc: Extended version of PMUY offering free LPG connections to low-income households.

name: National Food Security Act (NFSA) Benefits
ministry: Ministry of Consumer Affairs, Food and Public Distribution
desc: Provides subsidized food grains to eligible households under PDS.

name: Mission Indradhanush
ministry: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
desc: Universal immunization programme to cover unvaccinated and partially vaccinated children.

name: e-NAM (National Agriculture Market)
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
desc: Online trading platform for agricultural commodities across India.

name: Saubhagya Scheme (Pradhan Mantri Sahaj Bijli Har Ghar Yojana)
ministry: Ministry of Power
desc: Scheme to achieve universal household electrification.

name: Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana (DAY-NULM)
ministry: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs
desc: Urban poverty alleviation through employment, skills, and entrepreneurship.

name: MGNREGS (Mahaatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme)
ministry: Ministry of Rural Development
desc: Guarantees 100 days of wage employment per year to rural households.

name: Swachh Bharat Mission Urban 2.0
ministry: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs
desc: Mission to achieve garbage-free cities and sustainable sanitation.

name: Pension for Senior Citizens – Atal Pension Yojana
ministry: Ministry of Finance
desc: Provides minimum guaranteed pension to workers in the unorganized sector.

name: Stand-Up India Scheme
ministry: Ministry of Finance
desc: Loans for SC/ST and women entrepreneurs to promote entrepreneurship.

name: Solar Rooftop Programme Phase II
ministry: Ministry of New and Renewable Energy
desc: Subsidy-based support for installing solar rooftops for residential users.

name: National Supercomputing Mission
ministry: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
desc: Mission to enhance India’s computing capabilities with a network of supercomputers.

detailedDescription_md: Provides all-weather road connectivity to eligible unconnected inhabited habitations in rural areas.

applicationProcess.instruction: Project identification is carried out by State/central agencies. Official PMGSY website with program details and tenders: https://pmgsy.gov.in/ (implementing agencies / NRIDA portals — no individual citizen 'apply' form).
Procurement and construction by implementing agencies; for tenders or e-procurement see PMGSY eTender portals (example): https://www.pmgsytenders.gov.in/ or the state's PMGSY portal.

eligibilityDescription_md: Rural habitations without all-weather road connectivity are prioritised as per guidelines.

benefits.name: Road connectivity
benefits.details: Improved access to markets, schools and services; year-round all-weather roads leading to improved mobility and livelihoods.

faqs.question: Who implements?
faqs.answer: State PWD/Rural Development departments with central funding (National Rural Infrastructure Development Agency/NRIDA coordinates). See PMGSY FAQs on official site.

faqs.question: Can individuals apply?
faqs.answer: No — PMGSY works through state/district agencies. Citizens can raise grievances or view project info on PMGSY/KnowYourRoad portals.

documents_required.name: Project proposals/records
documents_required.url: https://pmgsy.gov.in/ (state implementing agencies upload project DPRs and related documents)

nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
detailedDescription_md: Provides flexible funding for states to strengthen health systems, primary healthcare, and essential services.

applicationProcess.instruction: State health departments prepare and submit plans. For scheme details and state-level contact/online services see https://nhm.gov.in/.
Implementation through state/district health societies. For specific services (eg. facility empanelment, NHM recruitments) use the state NHM portals linked from the NHM site.

eligibilityDescription_md: Universal public health services available through government facilities to eligible populations.

benefits.name: Primary healthcare
benefits.details: Improved maternal, neonatal and child health services; immunisation; disease control programmes; strengthened primary & community health infrastructure.

faqs.question: How to access services?
faqs.answer: Visit public health centres, government hospitals or use state NHM portals. NHM site lists state links and schemes: https://nhm.gov.in/.

faqs.question: Can I get a job under NHM?
faqs.answer: NHM hires via state/district health societies; vacancies are published on NHM state portals—check the NHM website for links.

documents_required.name: Identity proof (for certified services)
documents_required.url: https://nhm.gov.in/ (state NHM portals list documentation for specific services; typically Aadhaar, ID, address proof for certified services)

nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Consumer Affairs, Food & Public Distribution
detailedDescription_md: Provides subsidised food grains to eligible households through ration cards and fair price shops.

applicationProcess.instruction: Ration cards and NFSA beneficiary lists are managed by states. Apply for a new ration card or other PDS services through your State/UT Food & Civil Supplies online portal; NFSA central guidance & state portal links: https://nfsa.gov.in/portal/apply_ration_card
Collect subsidised grains from designated fair price shops (FPS) using your ration card or One Nation One Ration Card arrangements; check state FPS portals (links on NFSA/DFPD site).

eligibilityDescription_md: Households listed under NFSA or state-specific beneficiary lists receive entitlements per quota.

benefits.name: Subsidized food grains
benefits.details: Wheat, rice and coarse grains as allocated under NFSA/TPDS; stabilises food security and reduces household food expenditure.

faqs.question: How to get ration card?
faqs.answer: Apply at your local civil supplies office or via your state/UT food supply portal. NFSA central page links to state portals: https://nfsa.gov.in/portal/apply_ration_card

faqs.question: How to use One Nation One Ration Card?
faqs.answer: Check the central ANM/One Nation One Ration Card guidance on NFSA portal and your state food portal for portability procedures.

documents_required.name: Identity proof
documents_required.url: https://nfsa.gov.in/portal/apply_ration_card (state portals list accepted ID proofs such as Aadhaar, Voter ID, etc.)

detailedDescription_md: Supports state-level agricultural development activities to boost farmer incomes and agricultural productivity.

applicationProcess.instruction: State governments prepare project proposals and applications; details and RKVY guidelines are on the RKVY portal: https://rkvy.da.gov.in/ or the Department of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare pages.
Central approval and fund release for selected projects; farmers/entrepreneurs apply to state agriculture departments / relevant state DBT/Agri portals as per state procedures.

eligibilityDescription_md: Projects implemented by state agriculture departments and allied bodies as per guidelines.

benefits.name: Project funding
benefits.details: Central funding support for identified projects, infrastructure, technology adoption and value chain improvements implemented via state agriculture departments.

faqs.question: Who benefits?
faqs.answer: Farmers and agri-communities via state projects; project sponsors (state agencies, FPOs, cooperatives) depending on component.

faqs.question: Where to apply?
faqs.answer: Application goes through state agriculture department portals — central information at https://rkvy.da.gov.in/.

documents_required.name: Project proposals
documents_required.url: https://rkvy.da.gov.in/ (RKVY guidelines and formats for project proposals)

detailedDescription_md: Promotes ayurveda, yoga, naturopathy, unani, siddha and homoeopathy systems of medicine via infrastructure and services.

applicationProcess.instruction: State AYUSH cells submit proposals and NGOs/practitioners apply for grants via the AYUSH/ NAM portals or state AYUSH websites; central portal and NGO portal: https://namayush.gov.in/ and https://ngo.ayush.gov.in/ (for NGO proposals).
Implementation and release of grants as per guidelines; practitioners/facilities register with State AYUSH authorities per state rules.

eligibilityDescription_md: Public and practitioners in AYUSH systems benefit through strengthened services and infrastructure.

benefits.name: Strengthened AYUSH facilities
benefits.details: Infrastructure support, training, outreach and service delivery improvements for AYUSH practitioners and health centres.

faqs.question: What does AYUSH cover?
faqs.answer: Ayurveda, Yoga & Naturopathy, Unani, Siddha and Homoeopathy. See NAM portal: https://namayush.gov.in/.

faqs.question: How do NGOs apply for NAM grants?
faqs.answer: Use the AYUSH NGO portal: https://ngo.ayush.gov.in/ for scheme-specific application processes and templates.

documents_required.name: Facility proposals/registrations
documents_required.url: https://namayush.gov.in/ (operational guidelines and formats for proposals)

nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Women and Child Development
detailedDescription_md: Aims to improve nutritional outcomes for children, pregnant women and lactating mothers through convergence and targeted interventions.

applicationProcess.instruction: States roll out interventions through Anganwadi and health systems. For program resources, Poshan Tracker and state links see https://poshanabhiyaan.gov.in/.
Community mobilisation and enrolment is done via Anganwadi centres — families contact local Anganwadi/ICDS officer for enrolment and services.

eligibilityDescription_md: Children and women in target groups identified by local health/ICDS records.

benefits.name: Nutrition interventions
benefits.details: Supplementary nutrition, growth monitoring, counseling, and community awareness to reduce malnutrition and improve maternal-child health.

faqs.question: Who is covered?
faqs.answer: Pregnant women, lactating mothers and children in target age groups; contact your local Anganwadi centre for registration.

faqs.question: How are beneficiaries identified?
faqs.answer: Local health/ICDS records and community screening using Poshan Tracker; state ICDS/Anganwadi lists.

documents_required.name: Health/Anganwadi records
documents_required.url: https://poshanabhiyaan.gov.in/ (guidance & tools; local Anganwadi maintains records)

nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs
schemeName: PM SVANidhi (PM Street Vendor’s AtmaNirbhar Nidhi)
detailedDescription_md: Provides affordable working capital loans to street vendors to restart livelihoods post-COVID disruptions.

applicationProcess.instruction: Street vendors register with local authorities and apply online or through Common Service Centres (CSCs). Apply and register (portal & UMANG links): https://pmsvanidhi.mohua.gov.in/ or via UMANG/CSC.
Loan disbursal happens through participating banks; tracking and status are on the PM-SVANidhi portal and vendor app (example: PM SVANidhi mobile app and portal).

eligibilityDescription_md: Street vendors identified in the pre-pandemic lists or through municipal certification are eligible.

benefits.name: Working capital loans
benefits.details: Collateral-free microloans, digital transactions incentives and credit-linked benefits to restore businesses.

faqs.question: Who can apply?
faqs.answer: Street vendors with municipal certification or eligible local lists; apply via the PM-SVANidhi portal or CSC. See https://pmsvanidhi.mohua.gov.in/.

faqs.question: What documents are needed?
faqs.answer: Vendor ID/certification, Aadhaar, bank account details—see portal for full checklist.

documents_required.name: Vendor ID/certification
documents_required.url: https://pmsvanidhi.mohua.gov.in/ (portal lists required proof of vending / municipal certificate)

nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports
detailedDescription_md: National programme to develop sporting talent at grassroots level and promote sports culture in the country.

applicationProcess.instruction: Talent identification and athlete/coach registration is done via Khelo India portals (NSRS / athlete dashboards). Register or get information: https://kheloindia.gov.in/ and NSRS: https://nsrs.kheloindia.gov.in/.
Selected athletes are supported through state/national centres; follow state sports bodies or Khelo India notifications for selection and scholarship applications.

eligibilityDescription_md: Young athletes identified through talent search and state-level trials are eligible for support.

benefits.name: Scholarships & training
benefits.details: Monetary support, coaching, access to infrastructure, equipment and competition exposure for identified athletes.

faqs.question: How to get selected?
faqs.answer: Through talent trials, school/college/state nominations and Khelo India talent identification programmes — see https://kheloindia.gov.in/ for events and registration.

faqs.question: Can coaches apply?
faqs.answer: Yes, for certain coach-development and certification programmes; check Khelo India portal for coach registration details.

documents_required.name: Sports records/identification
documents_required.url: https://kheloindia.gov.in/ (portal guidance on registration and required documents)

detailedDescription_md: Programme to encourage manufacturing in India through investment promotion, ease of doing business and sectoral initiatives.

applicationProcess.instruction: Investors use Invest India and Make in India portals for facilitation; investor desk & support: https://www.makeinindia.com/ and https://www.investindia.gov.in/ (registration/contact forms available).
Follow sector-specific procedures (land, approvals) via Invest India facilitation / state investment portals linked from Make in India.

eligibilityDescription_md: Businesses and investors in eligible manufacturing sectors can participate as per guidelines.

benefits.name: Investment facilitation
benefits.details: Support for approvals, investor facilitation, sector-specific incentives and handholding through Invest India.

faqs.question: Who benefits?
faqs.answer: Manufacturers, investors and allied service providers; Invest India helps with facilitation and single-window support.

faqs.question: How to connect with state incentives?
faqs.answer: Use Make in India / Invest India to find state incentive pages and contact the investor facilitation desk.

documents_required.name: Company registration
documents_required.url: https://www.investindia.gov.in/ (investor facilitation links and application forms)

schemeName: Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana - National Rural Livelihoods Mission (DAY-NRLM)
detailedDescription_md: Aims to mobilize rural poor into self-help groups and provide livelihood support and financial inclusion.

applicationProcess.instruction: Community mobilization and SHG formation is done by field teams; individuals can register or get details via NRLM/Aajeevika portals. Register or find membership info: https://aajeevika.gov.in/en/member/register or https://nrlm.gov.in/.
Access to credit, training and market linkages is facilitated by state NHLM/NRLM teams and partner banks—contact local NRLM office (links on portal).

eligibilityDescription_md: Rural poor households are targeted for inclusion in SHGs and livelihood activities.

benefits.name: Livelihood support
benefits.details: Credit linkages, skill training, market access, social mobilisation and enterprise development through SHGs and federations.

faqs.question: Who can join?
faqs.answer: Rural poor households — usually women — are mobilised into SHGs; registration/help available via local NRLM/Aajeevika offices.

faqs.question: How to register as a member?
faqs.answer: Contact your local NRLM/Aajeevika field team or register on the Aajeevika/NRLM portal (links on https://nrlm.gov.in/).

documents_required.name: Household details/ID
documents_required.url: https://nrlm.gov.in/ (state NRLM offices list documents; typically Aadhaar, address proof and household details)

nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying
detailedDescription_md: Focuses on sustainable development of fisheries, aquaculture and allied sectors to boost incomes and production.

applicationProcess.instruction: State fisheries departments submit project plans; fisheries entrepreneurs and fishers contact state fisheries or NFDB. Central info: https://dof.gov.in/ and NFDB/PMMSY portals for applicable project applications.
Implementation support/subsidies are administered by state nodal agencies — apply via state fisheries department portals or NFDB schemes.

eligibilityDescription_md: Fisherfolk, fish farmers and allied entrepreneurs can avail support as per scheme norms.

benefits.name: Infrastructure support
benefits.details: Cold chains, hatcheries, processing units, input subsidies, technical support and capacity building for fisheries value chain.

faqs.question: Who implements?
faqs.answer: State fisheries departments in coordination with central agencies such as NFDB and DoF (Department of Fisheries).

faqs.question: How to apply for infrastructure subsidy?
faqs.answer: Contact your State Fisheries Department or NFDB—central details are at https://dof.gov.in/.

documents_required.name: Fishing ID/boat registration
documents_required.url: https://dof.gov.in/ (state fisheries portals list necessary documents for subsidy/project applications)

nodalMinistryName: Ministry of New and Renewable Energy
detailedDescription_md: Encourages adoption of solar rooftop installations through subsidies and incentives for residential and commercial users.

applicationProcess.instruction: Apply via your State Nodal Agency or DISCOM rooftop portal; national level rooftop portal (PM SURYA GHAR) and guidance: https://pmsuryaghar.gov.in/ or check your DISCOM portal (links on MNRE site: https://mnre.gov.in/).
Technical inspection by DISCOM-approved vendor and subsidy processing (where applicable) — vendor/DISCOM handles application details.

eligibilityDescription_md: Residential and institutional consumers as per subsidy norms and capacity limits.

benefits.name: Subsidy support
benefits.details: Central/state capital subsidy (where applicable), net-metering, reduced electricity bills and environmental benefits.

faqs.question: How to apply?
faqs.answer: Contact approved installers or use the national rooftop portal: https://pmsuryaghar.gov.in/; your local DISCOM portal has specific application forms and vendor lists.

faqs.question: What documents are needed?
faqs.answer: Recent electricity bill, proof of identity, property ownership/No objection for rentals; see state DISCOM instructions.

documents_required.name: Electricity bill and ID
documents_required.url: https://pmsuryaghar.gov.in/ (national rooftop portal and DISCOM links list required documents and process)

detailedDescription_md: Provident pension scheme for small and marginal farmers to provide a minimum assured pension on attaining 60 years of age.

applicationProcess.instruction: Farmers register through Common Service Centres (CSC) or bank branches. Official PM-KMY information and registration guidance: https://pmkmy.gov.in/ and CSC: https://csc.gov.in/pmkmy.
Regular contribution is auto-debited; receipts and membership tracked via PM-KMY portal / CSC services.

eligibilityDescription_md: Small and marginal farmers within specified age criteria and landholding limits are eligible.

benefits.name: Guaranteed pension
benefits.details: Monthly pension after 60 years as per scheme rules (subject to contribution and eligibility).

faqs.question: How to join?
faqs.answer: Register at designated CSCs or bank branches; use the PM-KMY portal for details: https://pmkmy.gov.in/.

faqs.question: What documents are needed?
faqs.answer: Aadhaar, proof of landholding and bank account for auto-debit; check PM-KMY or CSC guidance for exact checklist.

documents_required.name: Landholding proof
documents_required.url: https://pmkmy.gov.in/ (portal/CSC provides checklist for land proof documents)

nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Women and Child Development
detailedDescription_md: Provides community-level convergence for empowering rural women through access to information, training and services.

applicationProcess.instruction: District level centres coordinate with state departments; for details contact local Mahila Shakti Kendra/district WCD office. Central WCD site: https://wcd.nic.in/ or Mission Shakti portals for state contact details.
Community outreach and training programs are organised locally; registration is via district Kendra or outreach announcements.

eligibilityDescription_md: Rural women and SHG members are primary beneficiaries of the programmes under MSK.

benefits.name: Capacity building
benefits.details: Training, resource access for entrepreneurship, digital literacy, rights awareness and linkages to schemes and services.

faqs.question: Where to access?
faqs.answer: District Mahila Shakti Kendra offices and outreach events; check state WCD or Mission Shakti portals for schedules and contacts.

faqs.question: Who can attend training?
faqs.answer: Rural women, SHG members and nominated beneficiaries per Kendra/ district schedule.

documents_required.name: Local registration details (if any)
documents_required.url: https://wcd.nic.in/ (state WCD pages list local Kendra contact & registration procedures)

detailedDescription_md: Incentivises MPs to develop model villages with better public services and infrastructure through convergence of schemes.

applicationProcess.instruction: Selection of adarsh gram is done by MPs; guidance and VDP tools available at PMAGY/SAGY portals: https://panchayat.gov.in/ and https://pmagy.gov.in/.
Implementation using central and state schemes via Gram Panchayats and district planning — citizens engage via Gram Sabha; there is no direct citizen application to 'apply' for SAGY.

eligibilityDescription_md: Selected villages under the programme receive focused developmental interventions.

benefits.name: Convergent development
benefits.details: Better access to services and infrastructure through coordinated plans and focused investments.

faqs.question: Who selects villages?
faqs.answer: Members of Parliament nominate and support selected Gram Panchayats; the scheme is implemented in partnership with state/ district/local bodies.

faqs.question: Can villagers apply?
faqs.answer: Villages are nominated by MPs; villagers can participate in Gram Sabha and VDP preparation — see https://pmagy.gov.in/ for Village Development Plan tools.

documents_required.name: Village development plans
documents_required.url: https://pmagy.gov.in/ (VDP templates/guidelines are on PMAGY site)

detailedDescription_md: Encourages service exporters from India by providing duty credit scrips for eligible services exports.

applicationProcess.instruction: Exporters apply for benefits through the DGFT portal (SEIS module). DGFT portal: https://www.dgft.gov.in/ — login to the DGFT portal and submit SEIS application as per user-help pdf: https://content.dgft.gov.in/Website/FAQs-SEIS_v1.3.pdf
Scrip issuance and utilisation happens via Regional Authorities and DGFT; follow DGFT user-help for steps and documentation.

eligibilityDescription_md: Service exporters eligible under notified service categories and performance criteria.

benefits.name: Duty credit scrips
benefits.details: Transferable scrips usable for duty payments—percentage varies by service category and policy period.

faqs.question: Who can claim?
faqs.answer: Service exporters meeting notified criteria; apply once per fiscal year through DGFT SEIS module — see DGFT guidance: https://www.dgft.gov.in/.

faqs.question: What documents are needed?
faqs.answer: Export documentation, invoices, IEC details and other supporting documents as listed in DGFT user-help for SEIS.

documents_required.name: Export documentation
documents_required.url: https://www.dgft.gov.in/ (DGFT SEIS user-help and uploads detail required documents)

nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises
detailedDescription_md: Provides guaranteed, collateral-free loans to MSMEs affected by the COVID-19 pandemic to support liquidity.

applicationProcess.instruction: Eligible borrowers approach lending institutions (participating banks/NBFCs) for ECLGS support. Central scheme info and lists are on Ministry/NCGTC or bank pages (example NCGTC): https://www.ncgtc.in/en/product-details/ECLGS/Emergency-Credit-Line-Guarantee-Scheme-(ECLGS).
Loan appraisal and disbursal under guarantee scheme is done by the lending bank/NBFC; contact your bank's MSME desk for application procedures.

eligibilityDescription_md: MSMEs with defined turnover/loan limits as per scheme circulars are eligible for ECLGS benefits.

benefits.name: Guaranteed credit
benefits.details: Working capital and term loans with government guarantee to ease liquidity pressure for eligible MSMEs.

faqs.question: How to apply?
faqs.answer: Approach your lending bank/NBFC; banks follow ECLGS operational circulars and application forms available with them or NCGTC notices.

faqs.question: Is collateral required?
faqs.answer: ECLGS is designed to provide collateral-free additional credit under specified terms; banks/Nodal agencies will confirm specifics.

documents_required.name: Company/KYC documents
documents_required.url: https://financialservices.gov.in/ or your lending bank's ECLGS page for specific document checklist (usually KYC, financial statements, Udyam/ MSME registration where applicable).

detailedDescription_md: Provides short-term credit support to farmers for cultivation and allied activities at reasonable rates of interest.

applicationProcess.instruction: Apply at bank branches (public/private/agri banks) with land/identity proof; some banks support online KCC application forms. Central information: https://kisancreditcard.gov.in/ and banks' agri banking pages (eg. SBI: https://sbi.co.in/web/agri-rural/agriculture-banking/crop-loan/kisan-credit-card).
Sanction and issuance of KCC is done by bank after verification and credit appraisal.

eligibilityDescription_md: Farmers, tenant farmers and other eligible cultivators as per bank norms can apply for KCC.

benefits.name: Credit facility
benefits.details: Flexible credit limits, crop cycle linked loans, and concessionary interest rates for agricultural needs.

faqs.question: Who is eligible?
faqs.answer: Farmers with adequate land records and proof of cultivation; tenant farmers and sharecroppers may be eligible per bank norms—check KCC portal and bank guidance.

faqs.question: Where to apply?
faqs.answer: Apply at your bank branch or through the bank's online agricultural loan service; KisanCreditCard portal provides links and guidelines.

documents_required.name: Land records/ID
documents_required.url: https://kisancreditcard.gov.in/ and bank-specific KCC application forms (typically land record copy, Aadhaar, identity and bank account details)

schemeName: Rythu Bandhu (Telangana - Farmer Investment Support Scheme)
detailedDescription_md: State-level investment support scheme providing a per-acre grant to farmers to cover investment needs for crops.

applicationProcess.instruction: Farmers register with the State Agriculture Department / District authorities; Telangana government scheme information and portal: https://rythubandhu.telangana.gov.in/ or state agriculture portal.
Verification by revenue/agriculture officers and periodic grant disbursal via DBT to beneficiary accounts.

eligibilityDescription_md: Landholding farmers registered with state records are eligible as per Telangana guidelines.

benefits.name: Per-acre grant
benefits.details: Direct grant (per-acre) to eligible farmer families each season for investment in crops (amount as per state rules).

faqs.question: Who is eligible?
faqs.answer: Landowners listed in Telangana land records; tenant farmers may have different eligibility — consult state portal.

faqs.question: How to check payment status?
faqs.answer: Use the Telangana scheme portal or district agriculture office; links on https://telangana.gov.in/.

documents_required.name: Land records
documents_required.url: https://rythubandhu.telangana.gov.in/ (state portal or district revenue records required for verification)

detailedDescription_md: National highways development programme to improve road networks for efficient movement of goods and people.

applicationProcess.instruction: Project identification and tendering is done by MoRTH/state agencies. For programme details, tender notices and documents visit https://morth.nic.in/ and MoRTH tender portals.
Tenders and construction administered through allocated agencies — contractors bid via official e-procurement/eTender portals linked from MoRTH site.

eligibilityDescription_md: Projects are selected based on strategic and economic significance as per programme guidelines.

benefits.name: Improved connectivity
benefits.details: Reduced travel time, logistics cost and better national connectivity for trade and transport.

faqs.question: How are projects selected?
faqs.answer: Based on prioritisation of strategic economic corridors, freight movement data and implementation feasibility as per MoRTH guidelines.

faqs.question: How to participate in tenders?
faqs.answer: Contractors follow MoRTH/e-procurement portals for tender notices and bid instructions: https://morth.nic.in/.

documents_required.name: Project DPRs and approvals
documents_required.url: https://morth.nic.in/ (DPR and approval formats and submission guidance)

schemeName: PM Vishwakarma Yojana (Skill & Self Employment for traditional artisans)
detailedDescription_md: Supports traditional artisans and craftspeople with skill upgradation, credit and marketing support.

applicationProcess.instruction: Registration of artisans is done on the PM Vishwakarma portal (CSCs also help with registration). Register: https://pmvishwakarma.gov.in/ or via CSCs.
Access training, credit and market linkages through the scheme's DPA/lending partners; follow portal instructions for loans/benefits.

eligibilityDescription_md: Traditional artisans and master-craftspeople recognised under local or national lists are eligible.

benefits.name: Training & credit
benefits.details: Skill development, registration, starter credit facilitation and market linkages for traditional artisans.

faqs.question: Who qualifies?
faqs.answer: Registered traditional artisans in listed trades; registration is via portal or CSC — see https://pmvishwakarma.gov.in/.

faqs.question: How to get credit/training?
faqs.answer: After registration, the portal lists training events and lending partner channels for credit facilitation.

documents_required.name: Artisan registration/ID
documents_required.url: https://pmvishwakarma.gov.in/Home/HowToRegister (portal guidance and Aadhaar-based registration via CSCs)

detailedDescription_md: Focused development of villages with significant Scheduled Caste populations through convergence of schemes.

applicationProcess.instruction: Selection and integrated planning for identified villages is done via PMAGY portal and district authorities: https://pmagy.gov.in/.
Implementation is through convergent line departments; village development planning tools are on PMAGY site and district nodal offices handle submissions.

eligibilityDescription_md: Villages with high SC population selected for integrated development activities.

benefits.name: Targeted development
benefits.details: Improved infrastructure and services via coordinated schemes for selected villages and beneficiary households.

faqs.question: Which villages qualify?
faqs.answer: Villages meeting criteria (SC population thresholds and other eligibility) — see PMAGY guidelines on https://pmagy.gov.in/.

faqs.question: Who implements village plans?
faqs.answer: Line departments at district/state levels implement projects under coordinated Village Development Plans (VDPs).

nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Women and Child Development
detailedDescription_md: Provides daycare/crèche facilities for children of working mothers and caregivers at workplaces and community settings.

applicationProcess.instruction: Apply through district WCD officers or implementing NGOs; central WCD guidance and state contacts: https://wcd.nic.in/ and Mission Shakti/Palna scheme pages where applicable.
Registration and monitoring of crèche centres is handled by WCD/district authorities; submit required forms to district WCD office or online portal when available.

eligibilityDescription_md: Children of working mothers and caregivers in formal and informal sectors are eligible for enrolment in crèches.

benefits.name: Daycare services
benefits.details: Safe supervision, nutrition, early childhood stimulation and pre-school readiness support for young children.

faqs.question: Who manages crèches?
faqs.answer: NGOs, community groups or implementing agencies under WCD; state Mission Shakti/Palna pages provide local implementation details.

faqs.question: How to enroll a child?
faqs.answer: Contact your local Anganwadi/ district WCD office or the registered creche provider for enrollment procedures.

documents_required.name: Child’s birth proof/parent ID
documents_required.url: https://wcd.nic.in/ (National/ state WCD guidance lists required ID and birth proof for enrolment)

schemeName: National Backward Classes Finance & Development Corporation (NBCFDC) Schemes
detailedDescription_md: Financial assistance and skill development support for persons from backward classes for self-employment and income generation.

applicationProcess.instruction: Apply through NBCFDC regional offices or the online registration/loan portal on NBCFDC website: https://nbcfdc.nic.in/ (there is a 'How & Where to Apply' section with application links).
Loan appraisal and sanction happen through channel partners/partner banks per NBCFDC instructions.

eligibilityDescription_md: Beneficiaries from specified backward class categories are eligible as per scheme rules.

benefits.name: Subsidy & loans
benefits.details: Assistance for entrepreneurship, training and credit facilitation for eligible backward class beneficiaries.

faqs.question: How to apply?
faqs.answer: Contact NBCFDC regional office or apply via the NBCFDC website's application portal: https://nbcfdc.nic.in/.

faqs.question: What are common documents?
faqs.answer: Caste certificate, ID, income certificate and KYC documents — NBCFDC site provides exact list by scheme.

documents_required.name: Caste certificate and KYC
documents_required.url: https://nbcfdc.nic.in/ (application guidance and scheme-specific document checklist)

schemeName: FAME India (Faster Adoption and Manufacturing of EVs)
detailedDescription_md: Promotes electric and hybrid vehicles through incentives for adoption and support for charging infrastructure.

applicationProcess.instruction: Buyers avail subsidies via authorised dealers; manufacturers/ dealers apply to the FAME portal. FAME Phase-II portal and buyer/dealer guidance: https://fame2.heavyindustries.gov.in/ or FAME India portal (vehicle subsidy is usually processed at point of sale by the dealer).
Manufacturers apply for incentives through nodal agencies/ portal — refer to operational guidelines on the FAME portal.

eligibilityDescription_md: Buyers of eligible categories of EVs and manufacturers implementing approved projects are eligible for incentives.

benefits.name: Subsidy on EVs
benefits.details: Lower upfront cost for specified EV categories and support for public transport electrification and charging infrastructure.

faqs.question: Which vehicles qualify?
faqs.answer: Specified categories (two-wheelers, three-wheelers, buses, and select four-wheelers) as per FAME guidelines; check the FAME portal for eligible models.

faqs.question: How is subsidy applied?
faqs.answer: Subsidy is typically passed at the point of sale by authorised dealers after verification — dealers/manufacturers coordinate with FAME nodal agency.

detailedDescription_md: Supports creation of modern infrastructure for food processing linked to farmers and agri-produce value chains.

applicationProcess.instruction: Apply for grants/assistance through PMKSY / MoFPI scheme portal (project proposals/EOIs): https://sampada-mofpi.gov.in/ or MoFPI scheme pages.
Submission of project proposal, appraisal and sanction via PMKSY portal and state nodal agencies as per scheme component.

eligibilityDescription_md: Agri-entrepreneurs, processors and farmer groups are eligible for support under specified components.

benefits.name: Capital grants
benefits.details: Assistance for cold chains, processing units, technology upgradation and value chain projects to reduce post-harvest losses and increase value addition.

faqs.question: Who can apply?
faqs.answer: Private processors, cooperatives, FPOs and farmer groups; check PMKSY portal for component-specific eligibility.

faqs.question: Where to apply?
faqs.answer: PMKSY portal: https://sampada-mofpi.gov.in/ (project application/EOI links on the portal).

documents_required.name: Project proposal and KYC
documents_required.url: https://sampada-mofpi.gov.in/ (portal lists application formats and required documents)

nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change
detailedDescription_md: A national strategy to reduce particulate pollution levels through city-specific action plans and monitoring.

applicationProcess.instruction: Cities prepare action plans and monitoring frameworks; for central guidance and PRANA/NCAP resources see CPCB/ MoEFCC pages and PRANA: https://prana.cpcb.gov.in/ and MoEFCC site.
Implementation and funding are coordinated with State/ city CPCB and MoEFCC; city administrations and agencies submit plans per NCAP guidelines.

eligibilityDescription_md: Priority cities and urban areas identified for phased implementation as per NCAP guidelines.

benefits.name: Air quality improvement
benefits.details: Health benefits from reduced pollution through source-targeted interventions and monitoring systems.

faqs.question: Which cities are covered?
faqs.answer: Cities listed in the NCAP priority list (non-attainment cities); check CPCB/NCAP portals for current list.

faqs.question: How to view city action plans?
faqs.answer: PRANA and CPCB/ state pollution control board pages host action plans and progress reports: https://prana.cpcb.gov.in/.

documents_required.name: City action plans/monitoring reports
documents_required.url: https://prana.cpcb.gov.in/ and MoEFCC site (city plan uploads and monitoring templates)

schemeName: PM eVIDYA (One Nation One Digital Platform)
detailedDescription_md: Unified digital platform to provide access to online and digital education resources across the country.

applicationProcess.instruction: Access learning resources through DIKSHA and related portals: https://pmevidya.education.gov.in/ and DIKSHA: https://diksha.gov.in/ (no conventional 'application' — platform access/registration via DIKSHA).
Enroll in digital classes as per school guidance or DIKSHA course registration — teachers/students follow school/state education board instructions.

eligibilityDescription_md: Students and teachers across schools and higher education institutions can access resources per guidelines.

benefits.name: Digital learning resources
benefits.details: Access to audio/video lessons, e-content, teacher training and multi-mode education delivery (TV, radio, online).

faqs.question: Where to access?
faqs.answer: DIKSHA (https://diksha.gov.in/) and PM eVIDYA hub (https://pmevidya.education.gov.in/).

faqs.question: Do I need to pay?
faqs.answer: Most PM eVIDYA resources are free public digital resources; some courses may be through partner platforms with their own policies.

schemeName: Pradhan Mantri Formalisation of Micro food processing Enterprises (PMFME)
detailedDescription_md: Supports micro food processing enterprises through credit, technology and market access interventions.

applicationProcess.instruction: Apply through the PMFME portal and state nodal agencies: https://pmfme.mofpi.gov.in/ (Use 'Apply Online' / Registration on the PMFME portal).
Cluster-level support and assistance is provided following appraisal; follow portal instructions for uploading documents and tracking status.

eligibilityDescription_md: Micro food processing units and entrepreneurs meeting scheme norms are eligible.

benefits.name: Credit-linked subsidy
benefits.details: Financial assistance for equipment, capacity building, branding & marketing, and cluster support to formalize micro food processing units.

faqs.question: Who can apply?
faqs.answer: Micro food processors, entrepreneurs, SHGs and FPOs as per scheme guidelines — apply on https://pmfme.mofpi.gov.in/.

faqs.question: What support is available?
faqs.answer: Subsidies for machinery, credit linkage, technical support and market access under PMFME components.

documents_required.name: Business/KYC documents
documents_required.url: https://pmfme.mofpi.gov.in/ (portal lists registration and document checklist)

detailedDescription_md: Initiative to support tobacco control efforts including cessation services, awareness and enforcement of tobacco laws.

applicationProcess.instruction: States implement NTCP activities through health departments. For cessation services, national quitline and NTCP resources: https://ntcp.mohfw.gov.in/ (toll-free quitline 1800-112-356 / missed call 011-22901701).
Set up cessation centers and awareness campaigns through district health authorities; citizens access services via district health facilities or call the national quitline.

eligibilityDescription_md: Public health programmes available to the general population through designated centres.

benefits.name: Cessation support
benefits.details: Counselling, quitline services, awareness and enforcement support to reduce tobacco consumption.

faqs.question: Where to get help?
faqs.answer: Designated cessation clinics, district health centers and national quitline (1800-112-356). See https://ntcp.mohfw.gov.in/ for more.

faqs.question: Is NTCP free?
faqs.answer: Cessation counselling and many NTCP services are free; call the quitline or visit local health facilities for details.

schemeName: Nai Roshni - Leadership Development of Minority Women
detailedDescription_md: Empowers minority women through capacity building, leadership training, and exposure visits.

applicationProcess.instruction: Apply via implementing agencies and the Ministry of Minority Affairs Online Application Management System (OAMS); ministry page & OAMS link: https://minorityaffairs.gov.in/ (look for Nai Roshni / OAMS).
Attend training and linkages organised by nodal NGOs/implementing bodies after selection; follow ministry guidance for schedules and venue.

eligibilityDescription_md: Minority women selected through local nominations and programme criteria.

benefits.name: Training
benefits.details: Leadership, life skills, entrepreneurship and socio-economic empowerment training; exposure visits and networking.

faqs.question: Who can attend?
faqs.answer: Minority women nominated by implementing agencies or selected as per scheme guidelines; see Ministry page and OAMS for application windows.

faqs.question: How to apply?
faqs.answer: Check the Ministry of Minority Affairs site and Nai Roshni OAMS link for application announcements: https://minorityaffairs.gov.in/.

documents_required.name: Minority certificate/ID
documents_required.url: https://minorityaffairs.gov.in/ (scheme guidelines specify documents like minority certificate, ID, and nomination letters)

detailedDescription_md: Financial and operational turnaround programme for state power distribution companies (DISCOMs) through reforms and restructuring.

applicationProcess.instruction: State governments sign MoUs and implement reform measures; information and MoUs are available on Ministry of Power pages: https://powermin.gov.in/ (UDAY section).
Monitoring and progress reports are published by Ministry of Power; participation is by state utilities (not individual application).

eligibilityDescription_md: State DISCOMs and utilities participating through state government agreements are covered.

benefits.name: Financial restructuring
benefits.details: Measures to reduce losses, improve operational efficiencies and long-term financial health of state DISCOMs; intended consumer benefit via improved supply reliability.

faqs.question: Who benefits?
faqs.answer: State utilities and indirectly consumers via improved power supply and financial stability; states must sign MoUs under UDAY.

faqs.question: Can an individual apply?
faqs.answer: UDAY is an inter-governmental reform programme — individuals cannot apply; consumer-level benefits come through other state consumer schemes.

documents_required.name: MoUs and state action plans
documents_required.url: https://powermin.gov.in/ (UDAY documentation and state MoUs are published on the Ministry site)

detailedDescription_md: Digital platform connecting job seekers with employers, career counselling, and skill mapping services.

applicationProcess.instruction: Register on the NCS portal and create a profile: https://www.ncs.gov.in/ (sign up to search and apply to job listings).
Search and apply to government and private job listings or use counselling services on the portal; follow the NCS job application steps when applying to specific posts.

eligibilityDescription_md: Job seekers and employers can register and use the platform as per service terms.

benefits.name: Job matching
benefits.details: Access to government and private job opportunities, career guidance, skill mapping and counselling services.

faqs.question: How to register?
faqs.answer: Create an account on NCS portal with necessary documents (resume, ID proof) — https://www.ncs.gov.in/.

faqs.question: Is there a fee?
faqs.answer: Basic NCS services for jobseekers are free; check portal terms for details.

documents_required.name: Resume/ID proof
documents_required.url: https://www.ncs.gov.in/ (portal registration and document upload guidelines)

detailedDescription_md: Network of access points to deliver e-governance and digital services to citizens in rural and remote areas.

applicationProcess.instruction: Establish a CSC centre through registration and approvals — CSC registration portal and guidance: https://csc.gov.in/ (operator registration and KYC process available on the portal).
Provide government and private digital services to citizens through the CSC network after approvals and training.

eligibilityDescription_md: Entrepreneurs and service providers meeting CSC operator criteria can set up centres.

benefits.name: Access to services
benefits.details: Digital delivery of government services, payments, certificates and scheme access for rural citizens through a local CSC operator.

faqs.question: What services are available?
faqs.answer: Wide range including certificates, bill payment, DBT enrolment, scheme registrations and more — see https://csc.gov.in/ for full list.

faqs.question: How to become a CSC operator?
faqs.answer: Register on the official CSC portal and complete operator KYC/training as per portal instructions.

nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs
detailedDescription_md: Urban renewal programme to develop smart solutions for urban infrastructure and services in selected cities.

applicationProcess.instruction: City challenge and selection are managed through central Smart Cities Mission calls; for city-level project details and submission templates see https://smartcities.gov.in/.
Implementation of projects is through SPVs and partner agencies — citizens can engage with local municipal authorities for city-level programmes and participatory processes.

eligibilityDescription_md: Selected cities with approved city proposals receive funding and technical support for smart projects.

benefits.name: Urban upgrades
benefits.details: Improved mobility, water, waste management, digital infrastructure and enhanced urban services in selected cities.

faqs.question: How are cities chosen?
faqs.answer: Competitive city challenge and evaluation process administered by the Smart Cities Mission; see portal for current list and selection criteria.

faqs.question: How can citizens participate?
faqs.answer: Participate via local municipal consultations, Smart City SPV outreach and project-specific consultations listed on city dashboards (links on smartcities.gov.in).

documents_required.name: City proposals and approvals
documents_required.url: https://smartcities.gov.in/ (city proposal templates, project documents and dashboards)
